results.title: White House Disavows Knowledge of Gag Order on Times Leaders in Leak Inquiry

results.title: Meadows Pressed Justice Dept. to Investigate Election Fraud Claims
results.abstract: Emails show the increasingly urgent efforts by President Trump and his allies during his last days in office to find some way to undermine, or even nullify, the election results.

media.caption: The newly uncovered emails from Mark Meadows, then President Donald J. Trump’s chief of staff, reflect Mr. Trump’s belief that he could use the Justice Department to advance his personal agenda.

results.title: A 7-Year-Old Was Accused of Rape. Is Arresting Him the Answer?
results.abstract: “Science doesn’t support prosecution of second graders,” one lawyer said. Still, in New York, children as young as 7 can be charged with a crime.

results.title: Michelle Wie West Was Ready to Retire. Then She Got Mad.
results.abstract: A golf phenom since she was 10, Michelle Wie West was ready to focus on motherhood. Rudy Giuliani’s vulgar remarks convinced her that she should keep fighting and playing.

results.title: Roger Federer Pulls Out of French Open
